bluejam.math

Class ModInt

  • bluejam.math.ModInt

  • public class ModInt

    An integer under a (prime) modulus.

    For any operations with two arguments, they should have a same modulus. If they don't, throws IllegalArgumentException.

    See Also:
    IllegalArgumentException

    • Constructor Detail

      • ModInt

        public ModInt(long value,
              long mod)

        Create an object with the value under the modulus mod. If the mod isn't positive, throws an IllegalArgumentException.

        Parameters:
        value - a dividend.
        mod - a modulus. Should be a positive integer. If it's not prime, division won't work.
        See Also:
        IllegalArgumentException

        @NotNull
public ModInt pow(long k)

      • inv

        @NotNull
public ModInt inv()

        Returns an inverse element of the value. To ensure m * m.inv() = 1, the modulus should be prime, since it uses Fermat's little theorem.

      • div

        @NotNull
public ModInt div(@NotNull
                           ModInt other)

      • getMod

        public long getMod()

        a modulus.

        Should be a positive integer. If it's not prime, division won't work.
